STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 29, 2024
JAMES PERLAKI
R E A C H
914 CHURCH ST,
FLINT, MI, 48502-1010
Re: License #: CI250201372
Dear JAMES PERLAKI:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 8/12/24. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Venus M. Decker
Child Welfare Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The light above the youth's room was loose and will need to be fixed.

V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
The agency continues to be financially stable as documented in their most current
financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The agency did not have non-compliances in last year’s interim and continue to
follow the rules. They did not have any unplanned discharges.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff are happy with the culture of their agency and did not have any concerns.
Staff vocalized enjoying their role.
Youth felt safe and are receiving services. Youth reported she is receiving
counseling daily and has had family sessions.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is well maintained and does have a welcoming home environment. No
concerns were identified.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
8/12/24
